All Classes

  • All Classes Interface Summary Class Summary Exception Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractStockModel
    The AbstractStockModel takes all the functionality that is shared between the SimpleStockModel and BetterStockModelImpl, as the only difference between the results of each portfolio is the exact functionality behind the Portfolio objects based into the portfolios saved.
    AdvancedStockView
    The AdvancedStockView interface extends the StockView interface to support additional methods for advanced functionalities in a stock management application.
    AdvancedStockViewImpl
    The AdvancedStockViewImpl class extends the functionality used in SimpleStockView, adding on additonal features to display the functionality of the BetterStockModel interface.
    BetterController
    This BetterController class uses a BetterStockModel, allowing for the tracking of portfolios over-time.
    BetterPortfolio
    An interface for the betterPortfolio.
    BetterPortfolioImpl
    The BetterPortfolioImpl class represents a portfolio of stocks that is tracked over time, this is achieved by storing the commands that are executed on the portfolio at a given date.
    BetterStockModel
    Represents the better stock model implementation.
    BetterStockModelImpl
    implementation of the better stock model impl.
    CommandUtils
    Adds commands to a delayed input stream, that then communicates with the controller.
    Controller
    The Controller interface represents a controller that can run until quiting and process commands given a scanner.
    DatePickerDialog
    The DatePickerDialog class represents a dialog box that allows the user to select a date using three combo boxes for day, month, and year.
    DelayedInputStream
    The DelayedInputStream class represents a custom input stream that can be appended to throughout the lifetime of the program.
    FormattingUtils
    This FormattingUtils class represents the utils for abstracting the formating of different types of tables, graphs, etc.
    GUIController
    The GUIController class represents a controller that interacts with the model and view to provide the user with the ability to interact with the stock data.
    GUIStockView
    The GUIStockView class represents a GUI view for the stock program, made using Java Swing.
    OODStocks
    The OODStocks object is used for storing all the stocks that have been made during a stock programs run time.
    Portfolio
    Represents a portfolio of stocks.
    PortfolioDialog
    text field prompt.: submit button name: "Create"
    SimpleAppendableInputStream
    A simple InputStream implementation that allows data to be appended dynamically.
    SimpleController
    The SimpleController class implements the Controller interface and represents a simple controller of the stock program.
    SimplePortfolio
    The SimplePortfolio object is used for allowing storage of specific stocks and quantities of those stocks.
    SimpleStock
    This SimpleStock object is a simple implementation.
    SimpleStockModel
    The SimpleStockModel object is made for use by a controller to communicate with the useful parts of the rest of the model (methods the user should have access to).
    SimpleStockView
    The SimpleStockView class is a simple implementation of the StockView interface, which displays data by writing it to the appendable given on create.
    Stock
    Holds the functionality that all stocks should have.
    StockAlreadyExistsException
    Represents an exception that is thrown when a stock already exists in the system, and the user tries to create a new stock with the same ticker.
    StockModel
    The StockModel interface provides a way for the controller to interact with the model.
    StockProgram
    The main program class that is used for running this stock program, that allows a user to interact with stocks and a portfolio.
    StockView
    The StockView interface is made to be implemented by a class that will display the results of the model's actions.
